Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_828: Snail's research suggests that a species of frog once lived on this island. They would've inhabited a dark, damp area, with lots of vegetation...
Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_827: Long ago, a rare species of cave-bat made their home here. Snail's documents suggest they were adapted to tolerate intense heat. I can think of only one place that could refer to...
Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_826: Hmm... these notes describe snake spines being abundant in the western region of the island.
Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_825: Surely by now you are familiar with artifact spots? Those wiggly... wormy things, in the ground. Try hoeing them.
Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_824: Before Snail got stuck in that cave, he was exploring the gully nearby. His notes describe the stones there as being full of fossils. I'd recommend breaking them open to look for bones.
Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_822: Given this environment's abundance of curios, I'd imagine panning in the river would yield good results.
Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_821: There are many species of fish native only to this island. From what's written here, many of the fish enjoy nibbling on ancient bones...
Entries.ProfessorSnail_Hint_820: Golden coconuts are a mysterious thing... not even I fully understand them. It would be wise to look inside any you find.
